title: Are teachers allowed to make your assignment grade lower for being late to class? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on the assessment. If the assessment required you to participate in something during the time you were absent, then yes. You might also recieve a lower mark if the assignment was due at the start of the lesson and you were late to class, thus handing it in late. Otherwise … i can not think of a reason to lower your assignment mark.

Possibly. In order to find out, you’ll need to consult the school administration…the principal’s office. The best way to do that is to have one of your parents call anonymously, mentioning that he/she has a child at the school, and asking whether chronic lateness can be used to penalize students. Of course, the easiest thing to do is to arrive on time and get your assignments in before the due date. People who are habitually late insult others, when they show no interest in punctuality. They don’t last very long in a job, when they leave school either.

Yes. In many classes, your assignment is due at the beginning of the following class. If you are late, then your assignment is late, and it is very appropriate to deduct points. Where, in the “real world” is being late acceptable? In the military, medical, or even transportation, “being late” can quite literally cause people to die. Appreciate that your teacher still gives partial credit, and learn to be NOT late.

That would fall into the participation/ effort factor if student was consistently late with no reason yes. Therefore this percentage of the grade would be affected. If we’re talking about Sally’s mom who drops her third grader off late everyday because she can’t get out of the house and implement routine of course not.

Ab-so-lute-ly! depending on the policy of the school and the teacher’s policy you can be penalized in a variety of ways. So - don’t be late. Not being late is a habit that will serve you well - forever.
Certainly if you’re late for the class that the assignment covers.
